footer.text: Character Guide • Playstyle: Barbara | Update Date: 01/26/2023 | Editor: Samantha#9907

description:
**Healer**
Use Her Elemental Skill, switch to any character that requires healing. When running Thrilling Tales of the Dragon Slayers, it is recommended to switch to your main DPS first. 
If in need of more than that, she can be played on-field for party-wide healing. 
*Due to her lack of particle generation, she should not be expected to have her Elemental Burst. It can be considered like a ‘panic button’ for emergency, high party-wide healing.*
**Driver**
*Generally, excluding Nilou Bloom teams with full Elemental Mastery builds, Barbara will still run a full HP% and Healing Bonus build. This is NOT a DPS Barbara* 
Barbara heals with her Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst, but also when she does Normal or Charged Attacks while her Elemental Skill is active. This allows her to heal more and drive certain teams effectively. Furthermore, she is a Catalyst with fast, easy to cancel animations, allowing her to hit enemies with Hydro in melee and ranged distances. 
For Bloom, Hyperbloom, Burgeon and Electro-Charged, other party members will activate their Elemental Skills and Bursts, transfer to Barbara and allow her to apply hydro and heal large amounts on-field. 
Examples include driving Thoma and Beidou’s Elemental Bursts requiring Normal Attacks and triggering Bloom with Nahida or Collei. 
*Barbara’s Elemental Skill is able to hit enemies to trigger Sacrificial Fragments, Deepwood Memories or Tenacity of the Millelith. The self-Hydro application is annoying against enemies using Cryo or Electro attacks but can allow for others to Swirl/infuse Hydro.*
title: Barbara | Playstyle
